name: a(n) is the number of solutions to the "sum equals product" riddle with n prices v_j, i.e., find positive integers v_j, v_{j+1}>=v_j such that 100^(n-1)*Sum_{k=1..n} v_k = Product_{k=1..n} v_k.
comment: See A380887 and A381619 for more information.
example: a(3) = 622 is the number of terms of A381619.
a(4) = 22640 is the number of terms of A381621.
mathematica: Length[Solve[100*(a + b) == a*b && a > 0 && b >= a, {a, b}, Integers]] (* Computes a(2) *)
author: _Hugo Pfoertner_, Apr 01 2025
